content:
Hey everyone, i am currently working on #20971. The goal for this is to add another tab to the drafts modal, where scheduled messages (that will be added with #11227) can be viewed an edited.
My (draft) PR for this is #22431.

I am currently at a point where i could use some feedback from you, about how my initial proposal looks, if it is usable and about which thing are functional/which are not ant what things i should add (basically any feedback you can think of! :sweat_smile:)

This is how it looks right now:

1. How it looks right after opening the drafts modal:

tmp.png

also, for the sake of completeness, how it looks in dark mode (although this does not yet look good):
tmp3.png

2. How it looks after clicking on the "Scheduled messages" tab:

tmp2.png

The time here is not the time the message was saved (as it is for drafts) but the time the message is scheduled to be sent

Again, for completeness, in dark mode:

tmp4.png

3. How it looks switching between the two tabs:

chrome-capture-2022-9-3.gif

Again, i am happy about any feedback you can think of! :smile:

Nice! A few thoughts:

  1. For the switcher part, let's make it look more like tabs rather than buttons. @Vlad Korobov may have a suggestion there, but you can take a look at our settings panels for some examples:

Screen-Shot-2022-10-03-at-10.05.01-AM.png
Screen-Shot-2022-10-03-at-10.04.53-AM.png

The Recent conversations redesign proposal also has an example.

1. I think we need to indicate more explicitly that the time shown for each message is the scheduled time, not the time it was last edited. Let's try just putting the words "Scheduled for " in front of the time in each message bar.
I'm excited to see us working on completing this feature!

Oh, one more:

  1. In the scheduled messages tab, let's change the title to "Scheduled messages". I'm not sure what the sync-ing across apps/browsers situation for scheduled messages is right now, but I would hope that we won't need the line about them not being sync'ed. And the line about deleting after 30 days should be dropped from the new tab for sure. :)
agree with Alya here. Also you can put those tabs in the header part of the popup
We have a reusable component for the tabs that you should be able to just include without writing much CSS.
What's the thought behind using drafts modal for scheduled messages, when schedules messages can have its own modal. We will have to add a new button for scheduled messages anyway, right?

I'm not sure if there were other reasons, but the one that comes to mind is conserving left sidebar space. Though I think if we move towards the redesign direction of using shortcut icons + a three-dot menu for extra options, that would no longer be an issue.

/poll
What should be the hotkey to open scheduled messages?

We can add a button in the schedule popover in the compose box to display the overlay
image.png
I think it's a rare enough action that we don't necessarily need a shortcut key, but happy to hear other perspectives.

For the compose box button, we should probably just go with a simple down-angle button to open the menu. I think having a more complex icon on a button you use all the time will be too distracting.

For reference, that's the approach taken by Gmail:
Screen-Shot-2022-11-28-at-8.57.03-AM.png

And Slack:
Screen-Shot-2022-11-28-at-8.57.11-AM.png
I don't recall how we came to the conclusion to use the calendar icon but the up/down arrow does makes sense.

Not sure if this has been addressed yet but when you hover over the send later button, the tooltip appears to be cut off
image.png

Also there isn't any delays on the tooltips, which makes it weird as there are delays on every other tooltip in the compose box.
If there's a delay on the "Go to conversation" arrow, it's quite short. That should probably get a delay as well, for consistency.
I feel it is fine to for "Go to conversation" to have a quick tooltip, since you can't guess what it does until you hover over it and it is feature very unique to Zulip.
Hm, I can see that argument. A tiny pause might prevent it from flickering on as one passes the mouse over it, though?
Okay, sure!
Opened #25174

I think we should add more side padding on the "Send" button. While I haven't actually been misclicking, it feels harder than it should to click "Send" rather than "^", given how much more rarely "^" will be used.
Ok, will do.

I have a couple other questions about that button:

  • Is the chevron upside down from what would be more intuitive? Or should it be a \vdots menu?
  • Is the "Send" text a bit above center within the button pill? Maybe it isn't and it's just that we have tall letters and none like g that stick down, but I'm not sure.

Is the chevron upside down from what would be more intuitive?

I'm not sure, since the menu opens upwards, but maybe? Slack points it down. Gmail points it down, but flips it when you open the menu -- we didn't like this approach when manually testing the PR with the large chevron we are using; Gmail's triangle is a lot smaller.
We could switch to \vdots, since that's what we're moving to in #24878 anyway (when the "Enter to send" option will be moved into the same menu).
I like the idea of just trying switching it to \vdots, given that context.

@Vlad Korobov we're probably as an intermediate step going to want to "Scheduled messages" item in the left sidebar under "Drafts"; probably it'll only be visible if you actually have any scheduled to manage clutter, but we need an icon for the feature.

I think a clock would be most natural in some sense, but we're already using that for "Recent conversations", so this will need some thinking.
If I may suggest something, I think a hourglass :times_up: icon or a stopwatch :stopwatch:Ô∏è icon could work here?

I think the stopwatch icon is similar to the one we currently use for recent conversations, and it doesn't differ much from it. However, I believe an icon that includes a message symbol and a clock would be great. I am attaching an icon that I believe fully conveys the meaning.

Screenshot-from-2023-04-27-01-05-10.png
Since the UI for selecting a custom scheduled-message time is a calendar, how about a calendar icon?
That works too for me!
Here's a look with the calendar icon in place (working on a PR). Screenshot-2023-04-26-at-3.07.19-PM.png
Yeah, that looks great for this pass; we can always iterate further from there.
It certainly conveys the right concept, and I'm not convinced something better will exist :smile:.

Tim Abbott said:

Vlad Korobov we're probably as an intermediate step going to want to "Scheduled messages" item in the left sidebar under "Drafts"; probably it'll only be visible if you actually have any scheduled to manage clutter, but we need an icon for the feature.

I think a clock would be most natural in some sense, but we're already using that for "Recent conversations", so this will need some thinking.

I think calendar icon would work

Tim Abbott said:

probably it'll only be visible if you actually have any scheduled to manage clutter, but we need an icon for the feature.

Pondering Alya Abbott's feedback on #25302, I think there's a possible consistency issue with showing "Scheduled messages" only when there are messages scheduled to send, as none of the other items in that top-left area exhibit that behavior. Meaning that Drafts is visible whether or not one has any drafts.

And the same is true for the other items there. The only logic I can see for hiding stuff is dependent on the user's logged-in state.

More subjectively, having that new "Scheduled messages" item visible there regardless might help users learn about the feature who might not otherwise read changelogs or even experiment with the up-arrow button in the compose box.

I just really don't think it's worth the vertical space for the frequency with which we expect the feature to be used. The up arrow near the "Send" button is pretty noticeable for discovering the feature.
We will no longer need a special case for this once the left sidebar has been redesigned (#design > UI redesign: left sidebar ), but I do think we need it for now.

Okay. Thanks, Alya.

Do we have any kind of hook at present for determining whether there are scheduled messages? Or is that, like the count, still being developed?

#25240 will add it to the page_params data with live-update via the events system; so doing that will become easy once we merge that. Because Aman (amanagr) is sick, Lauryn Menard has picked up finishing that pull request, but I think it won't be ready until next week.

My proposal is that we merge this to main and plan to revert it for Zulip Cloud and/or a beta if #25240 has not been integrated; once we have #25240 it should be <10 lines of code to implement the "Only show if you have any scheduled messages" policy with live-update.

Screenshot-2023-04-28-at-11.19.13-AM.png

Only a small part of the scheduled messages button is clickable, we should make the whole thing clickable like other buttons.
Opened #25328 for fixing this.
Merged, thanks for the report!
